problem.markdown:
>>Let’s go back to the arch in finding 1 that is 25m tall, spans 75m, and supports a load of 100kN/m. Does changing the depth or the span of the arch have a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch? <<
( ) Changing the depth of the arch has a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch (x) Changing the span of the arch has a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch ( ) Changing the span and depth have the same impact on the compressive force in the arch
[explanation] Explanation: changing the span (or length, L) has a larger affect since changing the length will change the total amount of load AND the moment (or rotational motion). [explanation]
problem.p: Let’s go back to the arch in finding 1 that is 25m tall, spans 75m, and supports a load of 100kN/m. Does changing the depth or the span of the arch have a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch?

choicegroup.label: Let’s go back to the arch in finding 1 that is 25m tall, spans 75m, and supports a load of 100kN/m. Does changing the depth or the span of the arch have a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch?
choicegroup.choice: Changing the depth of the arch has a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch
Changing the span of the arch has a larger impact on the compressive force in the arch
Changing the span and depth have the same impact on the compressive force in the arch

div.p: Explanation: changing the span (or length, L) has a larger affect since changing the length will change the total amount of load AND the moment (or rotational motion).
